text: Brian Geoffrey Green (5 June 1935 – 14 August 2012) is a former football coach and player. As a player, he competed in the Football League as a forward in the 1950s and 1960s for Rochdale, Southport, Barrow, Exeter City and Chesterfield.Football League Career Stats at Neil Brown Green was later coach of the Australian national football team in 1975 and 1976. Green coached in Norway with Bryne from 1980 to 1982, and with Start in 1986–87. (in Norwegian). IK Start. Retrieved 20 March 2013. He later also managed Egersunds in division four in two seasons, 1989 and 1991. He also had a spell as a coach in Leeds United. Green's coaching career also included a successful stint at Chester, with the club reaching the semi-finals of the Football League Cup and winning promotion from the Football League Fourth Division in 1974-75 when he worked alongside manager Ken Roberts. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2012 deaths Category:People from Droylsden Category:English footballers Category:Altrincham F.C. players Category:Chesterfield F.C. players Category:Exeter City F.C. players Category:Rochdale A.F.C. players Category:Southport F.C. players Category:Colwyn Bay F.C. players Category:Barrow A.F.C. players Category:Mossley A.F.C. players Category:English football managers Category:Australia national soccer team managers Category:Bryne FK managers Category:IK Start managers Category:British expatriate sportspeople in Norway Category:Expatriate football managers in Norway Category:Leeds United F.C. non-playing staff Category:Association football forwards Category:Sydney FC Prague players
title: Brian Green (footballer)
